sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Tuesday, the 21st of June and the start of summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Welcome to the programme. These are our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Complex talks are continuing to try and unblock Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odessa to allow the export of cereals such as maize and wheat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Since Russia's invasion and its blockade of the port, tons of grain remain stuck.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But President Zelensky says efforts to resolve the problem are being made.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We are conducting complex multi-level negotiations to unblock our Ukrainian ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But you see, there is no progress yet, because no real tool has been yet found to ensure against further Russian attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Various solutions are being sought, including land options via road and rail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hungary has now offered its territory as a possible route for Ukrainian grain exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, people in Kramatorsk, in Ukraine's eastern region of Donbass, are seeking some sort of normality, despite concerns over Russia's advance in their direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The besieged city of Severodonetsk is only 50 kilometers away, but one local said they may be frightened, but this is home. Russia has demanded that Lithuania's ban on the transit of goods to the Kaliningrad

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: exclave on the Baltic Sea be immediately lifted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov told reporters on Monday that Russia vowed to respond to Lithuania's decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The decision is indeed unprecedented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It violates every possible rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We understand that it stems from the European Union's decision to expand sanctions to the transit of goods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: We believe it's illegal too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The situation is more than serious in this regard and requires a very deep analysis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The analysis will be done over the next few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Following the ban of coal, metals and advanced technology, Lithuanian Foreign Minister Gabriela Slansbergis responded to Russia's comments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Well, first of all, it's not Lithuania doing anything. It's European sanctions that started working from the 17th of June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And the industry that is imposing the sanctions at this point is the railroads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They informed their clients that from the 17th of June, their sanctioned goods, EA Steel and other goods made from iron ore ore will no longer be allowed to transit Lithuania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Located between Lithuania and Poland, Kaliningrad is roughly 1,300 kilometres from Moscow and relies heavily on supplies arriving by rail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Many EU countries are planning to send more weapons to Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, Italy's largest political party has slammed the Italian government's efforts to support the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And that may cause problems for Prime Minister Mario Draghi, who faces an important vote in Parliament over Ukraine, as our correspondent Giorgia Orlandi reports from Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Later on today, Italian lawmakers will be voting on a parliamentary resolution following Italy's Prime Minister Mario Draghi's address on the war in Ukraine ahead of the next European Council that will take place at the end of the month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We do understand that several resolutions will be voted, but one in particular has been at the centre of the political debate, and that is the one that has been drafted by five-star movement senators demanding that the government stops any further shipments of weapons to Ukraine, arguing that this would undermine any diplomatic efforts to try and put an end to the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We also understand that several lawmakers have opposed such proposal, saying instead that these would damage Mario Draghi's political leadership but also tensions have been emerging in the past few days within the movement itself tensions that actually reflect a division between two opposite sides of the party one that is represented by Luigi Di Maio Italy's foreign secretary who's very much supporting Mario Draghi's government and the fact that it is in line with the EU and the rest of NATO allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And another one that is represented by the leader of the Five Star Movement, former Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, who is actually very much against the idea of sending more military aid to Kiev, saying that these would simply extend the duration of the conflict and the suffering that it's causing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the UK, rail services will be crippled from today

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: due to the biggest walkout in the industry for more than 30 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Thousands of staff at Network Rail and 13 train operators walked out from midnight after last-ditch talks to avoid the strikes failed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Services across the country will be hit for three days, today the 23rd and 25th of this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Only around one in five trains will be running. The strike is due to a dispute over pay, job security and working conditions. The RMT union is asking for a pay rise of at least 7% to offset the rising cost of living, but it says employers have offered a maximum of 3%. On condition they also accept job cuts and changes to working practices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The government says wage demands that are too high will make it hard to halt rising inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The RMT and the Union Unite are also holding a 24-hour walkout on the London Underground, which will cause huge disruption to the service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well, today the biggest railway strikes in 30 years get underway in Britain, with tens of thousands of workers on the lines and those in the train companies as well walking out in a dispute.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The unions for weeks have been in negotiations with the operators, backed up by the government over pay and working conditions. With inflation running at around 10% here in the UK, the unions say their members deserve a 7% pay rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, the company's bosses themselves say that they'll only give 2% with an additional 1% if they agree to a change in terms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's been rejected by the unions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're saying that they're being called to shut all the ticket offices and for the members to have to work on Sundays if needed as well. They say that some of the changes would also jeopardize patient passenger safety. Now this will lead to disruption not just today but also the walkout days themselves Thursday and Saturday, the days in between and Sunday as well because trains and staff will be in the wrong place. It is so bad that people are simply being told not to travel on the train network coupled with today as well a strike on the tubes here in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Passengers I spoke to here at London's Kings Cross station were divided about whether or not this was the right course of action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Maybe it's fair and I guess sometimes this is the only way to get what you want, seeing all the strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But I think it just affects so many people that have nothing to do with it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a bit annoying, I guess, for commuters, but yes, they're not paid enough and I feel like they need to strike here. I'd say so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Obviously, my heart's with the workers and not being paid enough and being unstaffed after Covid, but I just think it's not the right way to go about it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: being un-staffed after Covid, but since I just think it's not the right way to go about it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The unions though are adamant it's the right thing to do and there are potentially other strikes coming down the line in other sectors like in the medical sector and in the teaching profession as well. Calls from some unions for a summer of discontent over the repeated calls from the government for employees not to ask for wage increases during a period of inflation, worrying it could lead to a spiral, though some economists and the unions themselves say that that simply wouldn't be the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What is clear, though, is that this is going to cost the UK government at least a billion pounds in terms of lost revenue over the next couple of days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The hospitality sector in particular, restaurants, hotels, saying that they've got a wave of cancellations.
